results.title: Why I.T.?
results.creator_credit: Dick Need, Great Britain. Royal Navy and Stewart Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Instructional Techniques”.
Demonstrates the need for adequate training in the complex technological environment of a large undertaking like the Royal Navy, and discusses the standard of instruction necessary.

results.title: A Class of your own (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Richard Need, John R.F. Stewart and Stewart Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Instructional Techniques”.
Primarily designed for the instruction of the services, this film puts forward principles that are equally applicable to teaching in the civilian field. The instructor must plan their lessons in advance, whether in the classroom or at the workbench. The lesson should have a proper introduction, be developed logically, and flow naturally and interestingly to its concluding summary. The value of class activity, teaching aids, planned questions and proper note-taking are all dealt with in this film. The film falls into two parts: classroom instruction and practical instruction.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Need, John R.F. Stewart and Stewart Films

group_works.title: How to innovate
group_works.creator_credit: Janet Isaac, Bruce Moir and Film Australia

results.title: Why innovate?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Innovations”.
A three film series useful in illustrating to teachers the nature and benefits of innovations in the school. Parents and teachers express views concerning education. One example shows children’s work displayed in a local pub.

results.title: What is innovation?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Innovations”.
A three film series useful in illustrating to teachers the nature and benefits of innovations in the school. Views are expressed by educators on the concept of innovation and why some people do not innovate in the classroom.

results.title: How to innovate
results.creator_credit: Janet Isaac, Bruce Moir and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Innovations”.
One of three films for use in the process of educating teachers about the nature and benefits of innovation in the school. Contains a series of trigger items or vignettes separated by blank film to allow the projector to be stopped for discussion purposes. It is essential that these films be previewed to assess suitability for the audience and to enable preparation for discussion.

results.title: Protist physiology (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
Examines the internal processes of independently living cells, including mechanisms for phagocytosis and digestion, and for saprozoic and autotrophic nutrition. Describes symbiotic associations between autotrophs and heterotrophs and methods of water balance.
